Register now for free , or sign in with any of these services: Home > Flint News Man carjacked while eating at Flint fast food restaurant
Published: Friday, January 06, 2012, 8:14 PM Updated: Friday, January 06, 2012, 8:25 PM By Khalil AlHajal | kalhajal@mlive.com The Flint Journal Follow 22 Share close Digg Stumble Upon Fark Reddit Share Email Print FLINT, Michigan —A man was carjacked while eating in his vehicle at a fast food restaurant near Downtown Flint this week, according to a police report released today.
The man was in the parking lot of Rally's on the corner of 5th Avenue and Saginaw Street around 8:30 p.m. Tuesday when a male in his 20s entered the vehicle on the passenger side and pointed a gun at the victim, according to the report.
The victim told police the suspect robbed him of $2,000 in cash, ordered him out of the vehicle and drove off.
Police were seeking video footage from the restaurant, according to the report.
